decision_conditions:
Condition : 1 - The development hereby permitted shall begin not later than three years from the date of this decision.
Reason: In order to comply with Section 91 of the Town and Country Planning Act 1990, as amended by Section 51 of the Planning and Compulsory Purchase Act 2004.

Condition : 2 - The development hereby permitted shall be carried out in accordance with the following approved plans and specifications: [1711-BA-100, 1711-BA-101, 1711-BA-102, 1711-BA-103, 1711-BA-104, 1711-BA-105, 1711-BA-106, 1711-BA-107, 1711-BA-108, 1711-BA-109, 1711-BA-110, 1711-BA-111, 1711-BA-113, 1711-BA-114, 1711-BA-115, 1711-BA-116, 1711-BA-117, 1711-BA-118, 1711-BA-119 and Design and Access Statement. Received on 10/01/2025; Fire Statement. Received on 21/01/2025; 1711-BA-120-A and HMO Management Plan. Received on 18/02/2025; 1711-BA-112-B. Received on 13/03/2025].

Reason: In order to ensure the development is carried out in accordance with the planning permission.

Condition : 3 - Prior to first use of the development hereby approved, secure covered cycle parking facilities (for not less than five bicycles) for the occupants of the development shall be installed. The approved facilities shall conform to the current Westtrans West London Cycle Parking Guidance (or such other guidance as shall supersede it) in design and layout and be fully implemented and made available for use before the first occupation of the development or commencement of the approved use as appropriate and thereafter retained for use at all times without obstruction.

Reason: In order to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 4 - Prior to first use of the development hereby approved, the developer shall provide the required set of containers for the storage and collection of recyclable materials for the purposes of the Council's kerbside recycling service, to the specification then in use by the local authority's recycling collection service and shall notify the Council's refuse and recycling services when the development is first occupied.

Bins shall be stored within the storage area at all times outside of the collection service times and shall not be left on the public highway. The waste and recycling facilities shall thereafter shall be retained for such use at all times without obstruction.

Reason: In order to ensure adequate provision for waste and recycling.

Condition : 5 - Prior to first use of the development hereby approved, the Local Planning Authority shall be informed of the agreed naming and numbering of the large HMO and commercial facility to the rear of the building so that arrangements can be put in place to ensure that, with the exception of a person eligible for a disabled person's badge issued pursuant to section 21 of the Chronically Sick and Disabled Persons Act 1970 (or similar legislation), no resident or staff of the development shall obtain a resident's parking permit. Any occupiers of the approved development shall surrender any such permit wrongly issued or held.

Reason: In order to protect the free flow and safety of traffic on nearby highways and to support sustainable transport objectives.

Condition : 6 - House in multiple occupation - occupancy

The house in multiple occupation hereby approved shall not be occupied by more than 5 persons at any one time.

Reason: In order to secure acceptable living conditions and to confine the occupancy level of the House in multiple occupation.
description: Change of use of the existing residential unit on the first floor and second floor into a House in Multiple Occupation with associated cycle and refuse storage.
subdivision_of_building: Ground, First & Attic levels. Changes to internal layouts only. No external changes.
